title: David Pleat reveals the one key thing he saw in a young Dele Alli and why he convinced Tottenham to sign him
text:

Dele Alli has quickly become the most exciting young talent in world football. 
Only two seasons ago the 20-year-old was pretty much unheard of playing in League One with MK Dons. 
Don't get us wrong, he still picked up the Young Player of the Year accolade at the Football League Awards in his final season in Milton Keynes, so was certainly talented. 
But the progression he has made over the past two years has been frightening. 
Ali, who was signed by Spurs in that particular season, was loaned back to the club following his January move and finished his career outside of London in style. Dele Alli has become the heartbeat of Tottenham's team (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) 
Today it is very clear to see exactly what Ali has in his locker: his ability to score goals, his athleticism, heading ability, and his link up play with Harry Kane to name but a few. 
But what made him stand-out back in the day, and why was former Spurs boss David Pleat so adamant that the north London side should sign him? 
Well, according to the man himself, who spoke to BBC Radio 5 Live, there were a number of things that caught his eye, as to be expected. The youngster's talent was spotted by David Pleat (Photo: REUTERS) 
But one thing in particular really helped make Alli stand out from the rest of the pack. 
"He was very athletic, and he can run from box to box comfortably, he has got a nice stride, unselfish, decent in the air," said Pleat. 
"He was more of a holding midfielder, even though he got quite forward. Pleat was Tottenham manager in 2004 (Photo: Reuters) 
"I saw him away from home in a couple of games and his attitude amongst more senior players, he was like an old head on young shoulders. 
"It was strange really for a boy of that age, he was 17, 18, and the most important thing is the manager is really good at Tottenham. Pleat praised the way Mauricio Pochettino has handled Alli (Photo: REUTERS) 
"He has immediately put him into the senior squad, which some managers would have been reluctant to do. 
"Some of these boys need to go in straight away, because they can cope with it and Dele Alli has proved he can cope with it, and he has been a tremendous signing." poll loading Is Dele Alli a future England captain? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
